content.question: A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.You are permitted to use your calculator to solve an equation, find the derivative of a function at a point, or calculate the value of a definite integral. However, you must clearly indicate the setup of your question, namely the equation, function, or integral you are using. If you use other built-in features or programs, you must show the mathematical steps necessary to produce your results. Your work must be expressed in standard mathematical notation rather than calculator syntax.Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. For time <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 10"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, water is flowing into a small tub at a rate given by the function <math alttext="F"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="F of t equals, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, minus the fraction t over 10, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. For time <math alttext="5 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 10"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, water is leaking from the tub at a rate given by the function <math alttext="L"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="L of t equals, 0.03 times, open parenthesis, 20 t, minus t squared, minus 75, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.03</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>75</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Both <math alttext="F of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="L of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are measured in cubic feet per minute, and <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in minutes. The volume of water in the tub, in cubic feet, at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes is given by <math alttext="W of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) At time <math alttext="t equals 3"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, there are <math alttext="2.5"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic feet of water in the tub. Write an equation for the locally linear approximation of <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="t equals 3"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and use it to approximate the volume of water in the tub at time <math alttext="t equals 3.5"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

However, you must clearly indicate the setup of your question, namely the equation, function, or integral you are using. If you use other built-in features or programs, you must show the mathematical steps necessary to produce your results. For time <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 10"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, water is flowing into a small tub at a rate given by the function <math alttext="F"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="F of t equals, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, minus the fraction t over 10, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. For time <math alttext="5 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 10"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, water is leaking from the tub at a rate given by the function <math alttext="L"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="L of t equals, 0.03 times, open parenthesis, 20 t, minus t squared, minus 75, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.03</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>75</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Both <math alttext="F of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="L of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are measured in cubic feet per minute, and <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in minutes. The volume of water in the tub, in cubic feet, at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes is given by <math alttext="W of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) At time <math alttext="t equals 3"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, there are <math alttext="2.5"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic feet of water in the tub. Write an equation for the locally linear approximation of <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="t equals 3"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and use it to approximate the volume of water in the tub at time <math alttext="t equals 3.5"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b) Find <math alttext="W double prime of 8"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using correct units, interpret the meaning of <math alttext="W double prime of 8"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

(c) Is there a time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="5 less than t, less than 10"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which the rate of change of the volume of water in the tub changes from positive to negative? Give a reason for your answer.

(d) The tub is in the shape of a rectangular box that is <math alttext="0.5"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> foot wide, <math alttext="4"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> feet long, and <math alttext="3"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> feet deep. What is the rate of change of the depth of the water in the tub at time <math alttext="t equals 6 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
